content.description:
Best route on the Star Trek Wall.  Start up Crack of the Klingons.  Traverse left at the big horizontal and out to a stance at the arete.  Move up the face and arete on the right side using some rather hidden holds.  At the angling flake, move up and swing around to the left side of the arete.  Head straight up to the top.  Great position and exposure...bouldery moves.

Top out on the ledge for a nice view or lower from the anchors that are really there for the face climb that comes up from below the arete on the left side.
content.protection: Two-bolt anchor at the top.  Standard trad rack...small cams helpful.
content.location: Far left end of Star Trek Wall.  Climb Transporter Crack to gain the ledge and go all the way to the left end.  Build an anchor on the ledge and belay.

content.description: Climb a wide vertical crack with multiple horizontals up to a ledge with double-bolt anchors. Five other routes can be reached from this ledge.
content.protection: Large gear can be placed in the vertical crack and smaller gear in the horizontals along the route.  Bolted anchor 40 feet up on the ledge.
content.location: On the far left of Star Trek Wall. Starts on the right end of a large roof containing two bolted project routes.

content.description: From the two-bolt anchor atop Tractor Beam, head up the steep face above.  Follow good holds up a right, getting whatever gear you can in the horizontals.  Finish at a two-bolt anchor.
content.protection: Two-bolt anchor at the top...could easily TR this one.

content.description:
Classic spicy New River mixed climbing. Hard to read movement through sloping holds and small crimps leads to a fairly relaxed band of horizontals through a small budge. Long, blind reaches in between edges will bring you to a final mantel and topout.

The movement feels like fairly standard 11+/12- fare, but the   slick nature of the stone and hidden holds makes it feel much harder at first.
content.protection:
4 bolts + 2bolt anchor. Bring a single rack from #3 c4 down to yellow c3 or equivalent. The bolts are old (1990) and should be treated with caution. The anchors look relatively recent and are in good condition.

The first bolt is very high but can be clipped with an extra long stick. There is some gear before the bolt, but it could be tough to keep the leader safe during the cruxy movement in between
content.location:
Intricate face and slab climbing just to the right of the No Sign of Intelligent Life.

Look for 2 spaced bolts followed by a series of horizontal bands. Two more bolts lead to the top.

You can easily drop a toprope through the anchors after climbing and topping out on any nearby routes.

climbs.name: No Sign of Intelligent Life
climbs.fa: Rick Fairtrace, Hope & Jeff Uhl, Scott Jones - October 1986

content.description: Right-facing dihedral to the right of Transporter Crack.  Wide crack which can be stemmed up easily. Watch for spiders.  The route can be climbed and protected easily with out venturing way back into the chimney.
content.protection: Standard Rack.  some Small Tcus,  to bolted anchor
content.location: Dihedral to the right of the Transporter Crack.

content.description: Climb the face and seam to the wide V, then step over the bulge into the flaring crack on the right.  Follow it until you can get into the wider crack at the tree about two thirds of the way up.
content.protection: Protects well with nuts and a few medium cams. Tricams are useful too, if you're into that sort of thing.  No fixed anchors.
content.location: Obvious crack system splitting the face a hundred or so feet uphill from the Transporter Crack.

content.description: This climb starts near a small left facing corner and follows the crack system up the face. The climb that starts right of the giant hueco is "Beam Me Up, Scotty".
content.protection: Takes medium-sized gear. Double bolted rap anchors are located at the top.
content.location: Traverse 20 ft. from the Transporter Crack anchors past the giant hueco.

content.description: Start from the ledge atop Transporter Crack. This is crack farthest left.

climbs.name: Beam Me Up Scotty
climbs.fa: 1986 by Rick Fairtrace and Scott Jones

content.description: Climb the middle crack up the face using some great hand jams to get to a horizontal break and small roof. Pull up around the roof and head straight up. Move left to the anchors atop Crack of the Klingons or right to the anchors atop Impulse Power
